author: Sunny Rustles

text:
Not gonna lie, this, the music right before it when you're facing the giant baby, and the "Dryfield at night" music are still some of my favorite PS1 pieces.

Parasite Eve, both Parasite Eves, were this perfect blending of body/bio-horror and science fiction, along with excellent music and visuals.

Anybody else feel forever changed when they saw the rat clutch its heart and scream as it mutated in the first one?
author: The Widening Gyre

text:
@SupraDarky 
The game is amazing!  It's a shame it's such a long wait between PE2 and PE3 (coming out 2011 i believe)  I guess fans like myself just have to be happy that we're getting more of the story at all! XD

author: Akubar45

text: But yeah I finished it in 2-3 days and couldn't stop playing, so I still enjoyed it a lot. I was way overpowered though probably since I beat the last boss in only a couple minutes.
author: SupraDarky

text: I beat this game for the first time a couple days ago and I have no idea why I waited so long since I loved the first. I guess I would have prefered if Square didn't fix what wasn't broken, but it felt like a mix of the first PE and Resident Evil. Overall a surprisingly good game but simply not as memorable and unique as the first. Mizuta did a good job with the soundtrack but it definitely lacks the Shimomura touch.
author: SupraDarky
